text: language notes topic 3 geography and
nationalities learning another language
can give you the opportunity to see the
world in a new way
that's because language and culture are
connected when we have two people from
different cultures these have different
experiences they've learned different
things sometimes they may use the same
words but attach different meanings to
those words as a result there can be
misunderstandings let me give you an
example I think you know this word
continent it's a large area of land
right we divide the world into these
large land masses called continents the
question is how many continents are
there did you know there is more than
one correct answer I didn't always know
that I have thought there are seven
continents until I went to Russia then I
found out some people see only six
continents some people view Europe and
Asia as one landmass and they used the
name Eurasia but you can understand why
it was strange for me to see a Russian
supermarket chain with the name sigmoid
containment the seventh continent I
thought which continent to me as an
American the name wasn't clear but to
someone who sees only
countenance the name seventh continent
sounds Asterius the new continent may be
a new land with lots of things to offer
same word different meanings
there wasn't a shared understanding in
the u.s. our schools teach that there
are seven continents what are they North
America South America Europe Asia Africa
Australia and Antarctica one two three
four five six seven and note how I wrote
these names these are geographical names
proper nouns so they begin with a
capital letter as I prepared this lesson
I decided to talk to more people people
from other countries and again I asked
how many continents are there I found
out that some people see not seven and
not even six but five continents that's
because they put Europe and Asia
together but also North America and
South America together as one and they
may use the name America or the Americas
this made me think I probably need
make a note about nationalities and
that's what I'll do next people may view
North and South America as one or two
continents it doesn't change the fact
that there are many countries in North
and South America one of those countries
is my country the United States of
America the USA that's the name of my
country to refer to my nationality
there's only one word I could use
American American could be a noun or an
adjective I'm American I'm an American
now remember what I said sometimes
people can use the same word but attach
different meanings to that word in the
u.s. the word American refers only to
people in the United States of America
it's not because we wish to exclude or
offend anyone it's not because we see
the USA as the only country in this
region of the world it's simply because
we have no other word I can't say that
I'm a not United Stated or United
Station those word forms don't exist
I can only use the word American
nationalities are an interesting thing
to learn and there are many of them
remember that we can have very different
words or forms to refer to the name of a
people the name of a country in the name
of the language for example Americans
live in the United States and mostly
speak English my suggestion is to learn
the name
and languages the names of languages
that you need to know the ones that you
will refer to the most in your
conversation or in your writing there
are a lot to learn so just learn little
by little the ones you need to know the
most look for patterns for example
countries with names that end in O
usually have a nationality that end in a
n for example Mexico Mexican Morocco
Moroccan if the name of a country ends
in a usually we just stick on an end to
refer to the nationality Russia Russian
it's a Venezuela Venezuelan look for
these patterns I'll end here thanks for
watching and happy studies please visit
my website today at www.english with
Jennifer calm you'll find study tips
interactive exercises including practice
for this lesson vocabulary videos and
more
